item.title: Huluween 2025: Every New Title Coming to Hulu, Disney+, and ABC
item.dc:creator: Olivia Bono
item.description:
Hulu’s annual Halloween content hub is a candy bowl of new shows and movies for Halloween aficionados.

The post Huluween 2025: Every New Title Coming to Hulu, Disney+, and ABC appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch on Hulu

Ready for Huluween 2025? Huluween is to Hulu as Bloodstream is to CableTV.com. While our spooky-season campaign features horror movie recommendations and trivia, Hulu’s annual Halloween content hub is a candy bowl of new shows and movies for Halloween aficionados.

What new titles can you expect from Hulu, Disney+, and ABC this October? Keep reading to find out.

The complete Huluween 2025 schedule is all tricks and treats

Title Premiere date Watch it on
Electric Bloom—"How Tulip Became a Shelly: A Halloween Nightmare" Now streaming Disney+
The Man in My Basement (2025) Now streaming Hulu, Hulu on Disney+
Marvel's Iron Man and his Awesome Friends—"Iron Friends Trick or Treats" Now streaming Disney+
Marvel Zombies Now streaming Disney+
The Monkey (2025) Now streaming Hulu, Hulu on Disney+
RoboGobo—"Scaredy Bat" Now streaming Disney+
The Simpsons Stream: Treehouse of Horror (36 episode stream) Now streaming Disney+
The Simpsons—"Treehouse of Horror XXXV" Now streaming Disney+
The Simpsons—"Treehouse of Horror Presents: Simpsons Wicked This Way Comes" Now streaming Disney+
SuperKitties—“Franken-rat/Pumpkin Parade” October 1 Disney+
Mickey & Minnie’s Holiday Songs: Halloween October 2 Disney+
Marvel's Spidey and his Amazing Friends—"Night of the Goblins/Bat Attitude" October 3 Disney+
Something Wicked This Way Comes October 3 Disney+
Kiff—"Ye Olde Candy Shoppe of Horrors" October 5 Disney+

Stay October 8 Hulu, Hulu on Disney+
Wizards Beyond Waverly Place—"Spells Like Halloween Spirit" October 8 Disney+
Obituary Season 2 October 14 ABC (8:00 p.m. EDT), Hulu (next day)_
Vampirina: Teenage Vampire—"First Halloween" October 15 Disney+
Hand That Rocks The Cradle (2025) October 22 Hulu, Hulu on Disney+
America's Funniest Home Videos—"3604" October 26 ABC (7:00 p.m. EDT)
Dancing with the Stars—"Halloween Night" October 28 ABC/Disney+ (8:00 p.m. EDT), Hulu (next day)
High Potential—"Chasing Ghosts" October 28 ABC (10:00 p.m. EDT), Hulu (next day)
Shifting Gears—"Scary" October 29 ABC (8:00 p.m. EDT), Hulu (next day)_
Abbott Elementary—"Camping" October 29 ABC (8:30 p.m. EDT), Hulu (next day)

Watch free anime this October

Hulu has a great selection of anime, but you can find even more on Crunchyroll. Crunchyroll offers an impressive library of free (with ads) titles, and often adds a number of spooky titles to that list for the month of October. Keep an eye out!

The best Hulu plans to watch Huluween 2025

Plan Price Video Details
Hulu (With Ads) $11.99/mo. 1080p, 4K View plan
Hulu (No Ads) $18.99/mo. 1080p, 4K View plan
Discover More Hulu Plans

Huluween titles are available to all Hulu subscribers. When it comes to Hulu plans, it’s mostly a matter of whether you want to avoid those pesky ads—and if you’d prefer to bundle with Disney+.

Since Disney+ and Hulu are corporate besties, Disney Bundle subscribers can also watch Hulu content through Disney+’s interface.

item.title: Your Ultimate Guide To Watching Liverpool FC in the US
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
If you’re looking to watch Liverpool today, you’re in for another thrilling chapter of Reds football. The 2025–2026 season should be an exhilarating one under second-year head coach Arne Slot.

The post Your Ultimate Guide To Watching Liverpool FC in the US appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
If you’re looking to watch Liverpool today, you’re in for another thrilling chapter of Reds football. Last season was one for the ages, as head coach Arne Slot steered Liverpool to its 20th English league title. Sure, there’ll never be anything quite like Jürgen Klopp and his heavy-metal football. But LFC is still firing on all cylinders.

With Liverpool playing in multiple competitions, U.S. fans must navigate several viewing options to catch every match live. Premier League games air on NBC Sports platforms, while CBS Sports holds the U.S. rights to the UEFA Champions League. But that’s only part of the picture.

Below, I break down the best ways to watch Liverpool on TV in the U.S. From live TV services to streaming-only options, this guide covers everything you need to keep up with the Reds this season.

Jump to:

  • Liverpool FC channels
  • Liverpool TV schedule
  • Best Liverpool TV plans
  • LFCTV plans and prices

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channel is Liverpool on in the US?

Liverpool TV channels vary game-to-game in the U.S. based on the competition. You’ll need NBC, Peacock, and USA Network for Premier League match days, while Paramount+ is a must-have for UEFA Champions League and EFL Cup (Carabao Cup) games.

FA Cup games stream on ESPN+. Let’s just hope Liverpool make it further than the Fourth Round this season.

Want coverage en Español? Select Liverpool EPL games air with Spanish-language commentary on Telemundo, UNIVERSO, and Peacock. Meanwhile, you can stream all Champions League matches in Spanish on ViX.

Upcoming Liverpool TV schedule across all competitions

And we’re off! With the FA Community Shield now in the rearview mirror, the 2025–2026 Liverpool FC season is officially underway. Get ready for a packed schedule, as the Reds will compete across four major competitions: the Premier League, Champions League, EFL Cup, and FA Cup.

Check out the TV schedule below for the next ten upcoming LFC fixtures and U.S. channel listings.

Opponent Competition Day Time (ET) Channels
At Eintracht Frankfurt Champions League Wednesday, Oct. 22 3:00 p.m. Paramount+, UniMás, TUDN, ViX
At Brentford Premier League Saturday, Oct. 25 3:00 p.m. USA Network
Crystal Palace EFL Cup Wednesday, Oct. 29 3:45 p.m. Paramount+
Aston Villa Premier League Saturday, Nov. 1 4:00 p.m. USA Network
Real Madrid Champions League Tuesday, Nov. 4 3:00 p.m. Paramount+, Univision
At Manchester City Premier League Sunday, Nov. 9 11:30 a.m. TBA
Nottingham Forest Premier League Saturday, Nov. 22 10:00 a.m. TBA
PSV Champions League Wednesday, Nov. 26 3:00 p.m. Paramount+
At West Ham United Premier League Sunday, Nov. 30 9:05 a.m. TBA
Sunderland Premier League Wednesday, Dec. 3 3:15 p.m. TBA

Data effective as of post date.

Best Liverpool TV plans for watching the most matches

Now that you know Liverpool’s U.S. TV channels and match schedule, it’s time to explore the best TV plans for watching the Reds.

Ultimately, you’ll need Peacock, Paramount+, and a live TV provider to tune in. But spending around $100 a month on TV services isn’t ideal for everyone. If that’s outside your budget, check the schedule above to prioritize the matches that matter most to you.

Peacock Premium ($10.99–$16.99/mo.)

Nearly half of the English Premier League’s matches stream exclusively on Peacock Premium, including several Liverpool games. In other words, there’s no way around this recommendation. You simply need Peacock if you’re a Liverpool fan.

The NBCUniversal streaming service carries 175 live Premier League games per season, including Peacock exclusives and NBC match simulcasts. But many matches will air on USA Network, which requires a cable, satellite, or live TV streaming service to watch.

One standout feature of Peacock is the ability to watch Premier League replays on demand for up to 30 days. It also offers league highlights, studio shows, and documentaries, making it a solid option for Liverpool fans to stay connected all season.

Paramount+ ($7.99–$12.99/mo.)

Paramount+ is a must-have for watching every UEFA Champions League game. Apart from the European Cup, the streaming service also carries live Europa League, EFL Cup, Serie A, and NWSL matches.

I’ve been a Paramount+ subscriber since day one, and its soccer coverage keeps me hooked. But there’s plenty to watch between match days, from hit movies to binge-worthy TV shows. Best of all, you can test it out with a seven-day free trial before deciding if it’s right for you.

Hulu + Live TV ($88.99–$99.99/mo.)

Beyond Peacock and Paramount+, you’ll need a live TV service to watch Liverpool games on USA Network. While Sling TV offers the cheapest access, I recommend Hulu + Live TV for its robust lineup of CBS Sports, ESPN, FOX Sports, NBC Sports, and TNT Sports channels. Plus, its convenient My Stuff watchlist lets you easily track upcoming games not on Peacock or Paramount+.

Hulu + Live TV also includes ESPN+ at no extra cost. That means you can watch all FA Cup, La Liga, and Bundesliga matches, along with select Women’s Super League games featuring Liverpool FC Women. And with unlimited DVR storage, you won’t miss those early-morning kickoffs in the U.S.

Level up your streaming experience!

Your internet must be as fast and reliable as Mohamed Salah to enjoy smooth streaming on game day. Enter your zip code below to find top internet providers in your area.

Everything you need to know about LFCTV

LFCTV is Liverpool FC’s official TV subscription service that features exclusive club content. In the U.K., it’s available as an add-on via Sky and Virgin Media, while U.S. fans can subscribe online through All Red Video (formerly LFCTV GO).

At just $6.49 per month, All Red Video offers one plan that includes full-match replays, extended highlights, behind-the-scenes features, and exclusive interviews. All you need is a free MyLFC account to get started—and you can score your first month free with promo code ARFREE25. All Red Video works via the LFCTV GO app on platforms like Roku, Amazon Fire TV, Android TV, and mobile devices.

In my experience, All Red Video shines brightest during the preseason, when it’s often the only place to watch live Liverpool matches. It’s also a reliable platform for streaming entire game replays without juggling multiple services. But it’s not super necessary during the regular season if you already have Peacock and Paramount+ subscriptions.

How to watch Liverpool FAQ

How can I watch Liverpool today for free?

You can watch Liverpool matches for free in a few ways, depending on the competition. Games airing on NBC or CBS are accessible with a digital antenna. Meanwhile, streaming services such as DIRECTV and Fubo offer free trials for watching matches on cable channels like USA Network or CBS Sports Network. Unfortunately, Peacock doesn’t have a free trial, but Paramount+ does.

Does Peacock have every Liverpool game?

No, Peacock streams less than half of Liverpool’s Premier League games live. You’ll need a TV provider that includes USA Network to watch the club’s other Premier League matchups.

How can I watch Liverpool’s FA Cup and EFL Cup games?

In the U.S., all of Liverpool’s FA Cup matches stream live on ESPN+. EFL Cup games are available on Paramount+ and may also air on channels like CBS Sports Network and CBS Sports Golazo Network.

How can I watch classic Liverpool matches on demand?

LFCTV offers full-match replays from the past 10 years, including select classic games like the iconic 2005 UCL Final. Additionally, you can find classic matches, highlights, and season reviews on YouTube for a closer look at Liverpool’s storied history.

What radio station is the Liverpool game on?

SiriusXM FC (ch. 157) carries live radio coverage of select Liverpool Premier League and Champions League matches in the U.S. You can also stream game day audio from Liverpool’s in-house commentary crew with a free MyLFC account or a paid All Red Video subscription. Heads up: BBC Radio 5’s coverage isn’t available in the U.S. without using a VPN to bypass territory restrictions.

Where can I watch Liverpool FC Legends games?

You can typically watch all Liverpool charity matches on All Red Video, while some LFC Legends games also stream on the club’s official Facebook page and YouTube channel.

Will Liverpool play in the US in 2025?

No, Liverpool won’t play in the U.S. this year, as the team will spend the bulk of its 2025 preseason in Asia. LFC typically alternates between Asia and North America for preseason tours. After visiting the U.S. in 2024, an Asia-based preseason seems the most likely for 2025.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, compiled a list of all upcoming Liverpool FC matches and researched U.S. broadcast options. Using that data, he evaluated the best ways to watch Liverpool on TV in the U.S. based on game availability, pricing, and ease of use. Taylor then cross-referenced his findings with CableTV.com’s extensive sports and TV coverage to ensure accurate and reliable recommendations.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

  • How To Watch the Premier League
  • How To Watch the UEFA Champions League
  • How To Watch Soccer
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

The post Your Ultimate Guide To Watching Liverpool FC in the US appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 World Series: Dodgers vs. Blue Jays TV Schedule
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The defending champion Dodgers are chasing a repeat, while the Blue Jays are back for the first time in 32 years. Here's how to watch the 2025 World Series on TV.

The post How To Watch the 2025 World Series: Dodgers vs. Blue Jays TV Schedule appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Free on Fubo

The 2025 World Series will slide into action on Friday, October 24, and air live across FOX and Fox Deportes in the U.S. Baseball fans can watch the World Series on multiple TV platforms as the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers duke it out against the Toronto Blue Jays in a thrilling best-of-seven matchup.

This series is absolutely loaded with star power. NLCS MVP Shohei Ohtani and a powerhouse rotation lead the Dodgers. Meanwhile, the Blue Jays, who clinched the AL’s top seed, are led by their own ALCS MVP Vladimir Guerrero Jr. He’s been on an absolute tear this postseason with six home runs. This is the first time these two franchises have ever met in the postseason, and I can’t wait to see it unfold.

To help you tune in, I’ve put together this complete guide on how to watch the World Series. Keep scrolling for my rundown of the full TV schedule and best TV plans so you never miss a moment of the Fall Classic, whether you prefer cable, satellite, or streaming TV.

Jump to:

  • World Series TV schedule
  • Best World Series TV plans
  • Watch the World Series for free

Catch baseball’s finest on TV!

Enter your zip code below to browse your area’s best TV and internet providers.

What channel is the World Series on?

Every game of the 2025 World Series will air on FOX, with Spanish-language coverage appearing on Fox Deportes. Additionally, for the second consecutive year, Univision will carry its own Game 1 broadcast for Spanish-speaking audiences.

In Canada, you can watch all the action on Sportsnet, with Canadian French–language coverage airing on TVA Sports.

Want radio coverage? You can listen to every World Series game live on ESPN Radio and Univision Radio. Team-specific audio commentary will also air on SiriusXM.

2025 World Series TV schedule

The Fall Classic schedule is locked in! The Toronto Blue Jays will host the Los Angeles Dodgers in the best-of-seven series. Toronto secured home-field advantage with the better regular-season record, and the series will follow a 2-3-2 format.

All World Series games start at 8:08 p.m. ET on FOX, with the MLB on FOX Pregame show beginning at 7:00 p.m. ET. Additional postgame coverage will air on FS1.

Game Date Time (ET) English channel Spanish channel
Game 1: Los Angeles Dodgers at Toronto Blue Jays Friday, Oct. 24 8:00 p.m. FOX Univision, Fox Deportes
Game 2: Los Angeles Dodgers at Toronto Blue Jays Saturday, Oct. 25 8:00 p.m. FOX Fox Deportes
Game 3: Los Angeles Dodgers vs. Toronto Blue Jays Monday, Oct. 27 8:00 p.m. FOX Fox Deportes
Game 4: Los Angeles Dodgers vs. Toronto Blue Jays Tuesday, Oct. 28 8:00 p.m. FOX Fox Deportes
Game 5: Los Angeles Dodgers vs. Toronto Blue Jays* Wednesday, Oct. 29 8:00 p.m. FOX Fox Deportes
Game 6: Los Angeles Dodgers at Toronto Blue Jays* Friday, Oct. 31 8:00 p.m. FOX Fox Deportes
Game 7: Los Angeles Dodgers at Toronto Blue Jays* Saturday, Nov. 1 8:00 p.m. FOX Fox Deportes

*If necessary.

Best TV plans for watching the World Series

The great thing about the World Series airing on FOX is that you have a ton of options for tuning in. But to get the best bang for your buck, I’ve broken down three top options into a simple “Good, Better, Best” format below.

  • Good – Digital Antenna: My first recommendation is also the cheapest. Since FOX is widely accessible as an over-the-air TV station, a simple digital antenna can get you every single World Series game for free without a TV subscription. The antenna itself is a one-time purchase that’ll set you up for the Fall Classic through at least 2028. You’ll just need to be within range of a local FOX affiliate, which you can confirm using the FCC’s Reception Maps.
  • Better – FOX One: If you don’t have a reliable antenna signal, the new FOX One streaming service is your next best option. For $19.99 per month, you get direct feeds of both FOX and Fox Deportes, making FOX One the cheapest and most straightforward way to stream the entire World Series. The service even comes with 24/7 FS1 and FS2 access for additional sports coverage.
  • Best – YouTube TV: If you’re a die-hard sports fan who wants more than just the World Series, a full live TV streaming service like YouTube TV ($82.99/mo.) is the way to go. You’ll get FOX for the big games, plus a complete channel lineup with networks like ESPN, FS1, and TBS for full MLB Postseason coverage.

Which TV providers show the World Series?

While FOX is available across most TV providers, Fox Deportes may require you to subscribe to a higher-tier TV plan. I created the provider table below to illustrate which popular cable, satellite, and live TV streaming services offer the two channels.

How to watch the World Series for free

Get Free Local Channels

View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

You can watch the World Series for free through your local FOX station, but you’ll first need to connect a digital antenna to your TV.

Many of the best antennas cost anywhere from $20 to $60. But after the one-time payment, you’ll get free access to FOX and several other over-the-air (OTA) channels, depending on your location.

Pro tip: You can verify which OTA channels are within the range of your home by entering your zip code in the FCC’s Reception Map Tool or Antennas Direct’s TV Transmitter Locator.

One of my favorite antennas is the Mohu Leaf 50, thanks to its 60-mile range, 4K capabilities, and slim design. But our Best OTA Antennas page highlights several other great options worth checking out.

If you can’t use a digital antenna, the World Series is still accessible by signing up for a free trial through a live TV streaming service. Most trials only last about five days, so you’ll likely have to juggle two different ones to watch the entire World Series. I recommend starting with a Fubo free trial, as it’s super straightforward—just make sure to cancel on time.

How to watch the World Series FAQ

How do I stream the World Series?

You can stream the World Series on FOX through FOX One using a standalone subscription or a TV provider login. Live TV streaming services like Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, and YouTube TV also allow you to stream FOX. If you already subscribe to a TV provider that carries FOX, you can also watch the World Series through the FOX Sports app by signing in with your TV provider credentials.

Can I watch the World Series on Amazon Prime Video?

No, live World Series games are not accessible to Amazon Prime Video customers who subscribe to the in-app MLB.TV add-on. But all MLB postseason games are available on MLB.TV 90 minutes after they end.

Does ESPN+ have the World Series?

No, ESPN+ doesn't carry the World Series. While the streaming service hosts select MLB games throughout the regular season, the MLB Playoffs and World Series are not included.

Do you have to pay to watch the World Series?

You don’t have to pay anything to watch the World Series if you already have a TV antenna that picks up your local FOX station. If that’s not your situation, you can still tune in inexpensively by signing up for Fubo’s free seven-day trial. But that won’t last you if the series goes beyond Game 5.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, is an avid baseball fan who follows the World Series every year (even when his beloved Cubbies don’t make it). For this guide, he combined that fan’s perspective with hours of expert research. Taylor compared the prices and channel offerings of the most popular TV services to find the most convenient and cost-effective ways for you to watch the Fall Classic. He chose his TV provider recommendations based on game availability, pricing, and ease of use.

Visit our How We Rank page to learn more about CableTV.com’s ranking methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season
item.dc:creator: Ian McLaren
item.description:
Learn how to watch Toronto Blue Jays baseball on TV with our guide, featuring game times, channel listings, and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
In professional sports, few things are more frustrating than unfulfilled potential, and Toronto Blue Jays fans have felt that sting more than once in recent years. Despite a talented core and multiple playoff appearances from 2015 to 2023, the team never managed to make a deep postseason run. Big expectations often turned into big letdowns.

Then came 2025, and the Blue Jays turned out to be one of the best teams in the Show.

Toronto won 94 games in the regular season and grinded to an appearance in the World Series. The Blue Jays took the American League Division Series by beating the New York Yankees, and squeaked by Seattle Mariners in seven games to take the AL Pennant.

If you’re a Toronto fan itching to see if the Blue Jays can win their third title in franchise history, I’ll show you how you can catch every playoff game on TV.

Jump to:

  • Toronto Blue Jays channels
  • Toronto Blue Jays TV schedule
  • Best Toronto Blue Jays TV plans

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Toronto Blue Jays games?

How to watch in the United States

In the U.S., Toronto Blue Jays games are available out-of-market via MLB.TV, since U.S. viewers don’t fall within the Canadian blackout territory.

Nationally televised games (on channels like ESPN, FOX, FS1, and TBS) are available to U.S. fans via live TV providers or streaming services. But MLB.TV doesn’t include those live broadcasts.

How to watch in Canada

In Canada, the Toronto Blue Jays are exclusively broadcast through Sportsnet and its related feeds like Sportsnet One and Sportsnet 360. The network covers nearly every game throughout the regular season and postseason.

For French-speaking fans, TVA Sports (via a sub-licensing arrangement with Sportsnet) carries French-language broadcasts of Blue Jays games and some national MLB content in Canada.

Occasional Friday night Blue Jays games are exclusive to Apple TV+, which aren’t available through Sportsnet or Sportsnet+.

Want radio coverage? The Blue Jays’ flagship radio station is Sportsnet 590 The Fan (CJCL AM 590) in Toronto, with coverage available across southern Ontario. It simulcasts most games and is carried on satellite and digital platforms.

2025 Toronto Blue Jays playoff TV schedule

The Blue Jays finished the regular season as champions of the AL East for the first time since 2015, securing a first-round bye and home-field advantage. The team then defeated the archrival New York Yankees in the Division Series, and came from behind to beat the Mariners in Game 7.

Now, they face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series. Below is the full U.S. playoff TV schedule as it’s currently known, with all games airing on Sportsnet in Canada. I’ll keep the table updated as soon as more information comes out.

Best TV plans for watching the Toronto Blue Jays

Canada: Score a standalone in-market TV package for Blue Jays games

If you’re a local fan in Canada who wants to stream games without a cable package, Sportsnet+ is your best bet. A subscription gives you access to nearly every regular-season Blue Jays game that isn’t nationally televised. Once subscribed, you can watch online or via the Sportsnet app on your preferred device.

Just don’t forget to add Apple TV+ to your setup if you want to catch the exclusive Friday Night Baseball games, which often feature the Blue Jays. That applies to fans in both Canada and the U.S.

United States: Get MLB.TV and a live TV service

For U.S.-based fans looking to watch the Toronto Blue Jays throughout the 2025 season, the most complete and convenient setup is a combination of MLB.TV and a live TV streaming service.

MLB.TV is the best way to watch nearly every Blue Jays game, since they’re considered an out-of-market team in the U.S. This means you can stream all regular-season games live or on demand, with the exception of those that air nationally on channels like ESPN or FOX.

To cover those national broadcasts, services like Fubo, DIRECTV, or Sling TV are your best bets.

  • Fubo: A top choice for sports fans, Fubo offers access to ESPN, FOX, FS1, and more, along with the option to integrate your MLB.TV subscription directly into the platform for a seamless viewing experience.
  • DIRECTV: DIRECTV’s streaming option also offers full access to national channels and supports MLB.TV as an add-on, making it a solid traditional alternative.
  • Sling TV: For a more budget-friendly approach, Sling TV with both the Orange and Blue packages plus the Sports Extra add-on gives you access to ESPN, TBS, FS1, and MLB Network. Keep in mind you’ll need to manage MLB.TV separately.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Toronto Blue Jays FAQ

How can I watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free?

To watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free, your best bet is to sign up for a Sportsnet+ free trial in Canada, or a Fubo or DIRECTV free trial in the U.S. for nationally televised games. You can also check MLB.TV’s Free Game of the Day, which occasionally features the Blue Jays at no cost.

How can American viewers watch the Blue Jays most effectively?

In the U.S., the best way to watch the Blue Jays is with MLB.TV, which includes nearly every out-of-market game. Pair it with Apple TV+ for Friday exclusives and a live TV service (like Fubo or Sling TV) for games on ESPN, FOX, FS1, or MLB Network. This combo ensures full-season coverage.

Why should American fans care about the only MLB team north of the border?

The Blue Jays feature a star-studded lineup with names like Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Bo Bichette, plus they’re constant playoff contenders. Their games often feature thrilling matchups against top AL East rivals—and the newly renovated Rogers Centre is one of baseball’s most unique ballparks.

Why you should trust us

As an Ontario resident, lifelong Blue Jays fan, and a Sportsnet subscriber who also has Apple TV+ for the Friday games, I understand firsthand the challenges of navigating MLB broadcast options.

I’ve used that experience to make this guide as helpful and practical as possible for fellow Jays fans.

I created this watch guide with the specific viewing needs of Toronto Blue Jays fans in mind.

After spending a few hours researching the most up-to-date broadcast schedule for the Blue Jays’ 2025 season, I determined the most ideal and affordable viewing options for fans. Before publishing, I carefully reviewed every detail in this guide to ensure its accuracy and completeness.

Check out CableTV.com’s How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: The Ultimate Guide To Watching the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2025
item.dc:creator: Chantel Buchi
item.description:
Learn how to watch every Los Angeles Dodgers game on TV this MLB season with our viewing guide—featuring game times, channel listings, and more.

The post The Ultimate Guide To Watching the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

The Los Angeles Dodgers have the opportunity to become the first back-to-back World Series champions since the New York Yankees (1998–2000).

Just one year removed from winning the World Series, the Dodgers had to work a little harder to get back there. They beat the Cincinnati Reds in the National League Wild Card Series. They took care of the Philadelphia Phillies in the Division Series in just four games, then swept the Milwaukee Brewers in the Championship Series.

Now it’ll be a showdown between the U.S. and Canada as the Dodgers face the Toronto Blue Jays in the World Series. To keep up with all the action, keep reading this complete watch guide.

Jump to:

  • LA Dodgers TV schedule
  • LA Dodgers channels
  • Dodgers Spring Training TV schedule
  • Watch the Dodgers for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 Los Angeles Dodgers playoffs TV schedule

The defending champions start the World Series on the road in Toronto, starting on Friday, October 24. The best-of-seven series should be an exciting one. The Dodgers have had a few more days to rest than the Blue Jays, but the Blue Jays have home-field advantage.

See the full playoffs schedule below. I’ll update it throughout the series as more information becomes available.

If you don’t live in or near the City of Angels, you won’t get access to the regional sports network SportsNet LA. So, if you live somewhere like Baltimore and want to keep up with Ohtani and Yoshinobu Yamamoto among The Boys In Blue, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch games broadcasted on this RSN.

Dodgers fans will want ESPN for the final year of Sunday Night Baseball games, and you might also consider signing up for Apple TV+ to stream some Friday Night Baseball games.

item.title: NFL Schedule This Week: Your TV Guide to Every Week 8 Game
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Get ready for game day with our NFL TV schedule guide. We update this page weekly during the NFL regular season, so you can easily find kick-off times and channel listings for the week’s biggest matchups.

The post NFL Schedule This Week: Your TV Guide to Every Week 8 Game appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
We’re now deeper into the NFL season, but team rankings still feel completely unsettled. Last week was a perfect example. We saw the Broncos pull off an absurd 33-point fourth-quarter comeback, Matthew Stafford set an international record with five TDs in London, and the Lions make a definitive statement on Monday night.

Week 8 should continue that momentum, though I wouldn’t blame you if your sports attention is a bit divided. After all, Monday is the Sports Equinox, where all four major leagues are in action. Between the World Series, the start of the NBA season, and the NHL heating up, it’s a dream day for sports fans.

On the NFL side of things, I’m keeping a close eye on the Bills–Panthers and Cowboys–Broncos matchups. But my official Game of the Week is a classic rivalry featuring two storied franchises. To help you get ready, I’ve laid out the entire NFL schedule for Week 8 below, along with my full game preview.

Jump to:

  • CTV’s NFL Game of the Week
  • NFL TV schedule this week

Bookmark this page. Stay updated with the NFL schedule all season by saving this page to your web browser.

Find the best TV provider for football

Enter your zip code below to see the top-ranked TV providers available in your area.

CableTV.com’s NFL Game of the Week

Green Bay Packers at Pittsburgh Steelers | NBC, UNIVERSO, Peacock

Coverage begins Sunday, October 26, at 8:20 p.m. ET: As a lifelong Packers fan, this is the Sunday Night Football matchup I’ve been dreading all season. Green Bay is heading to Pittsburgh to face Aaron Rodgers, marking the first time he will ever play against the Packers. Of course, Green Bay is the only team in the league he’s never beaten, which adds an extra level of excitement and anxiety to the game.

Both teams have displayed a mixed bag of volatility and competency lately. The Packers (4–1–1) have scraped together two straight wins, but their offense remains wildly unreliable. If Jordan Love and company can finally get in sync, and the pass rush continues to show up, Green Bay will be in business.

Meanwhile, Pittsburgh (4–2) is coming off a loss where Joe Flacco orchestrated a 470-yard demolition of their expensive defense. Aaron Rodgers is still defying his age, but he simply can’t gunsling his way to victory like he did in his prime. He needs that defense to hold up its end of the bargain.

This is a true legacy game for Rodgers, a home underdog trying to complete his NFL “bingo card” against the team he led to a Super Bowl win (over the Steelers, no less). But I think the Packers’ defense, anchored by Micah Parsons, will be the difference-maker.

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest must-watch sporting events, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

NFL TV schedule this week

Every NFL regular-season game airs nationally except for the regional Sunday afternoon matchups on CBS and FOX. If you want live access to out-of-market games, you’ll need NFL Sunday Ticket or NFL RedZone’s whip-around coverage. All local and primetime games stream live on NFL+ for mobile device users.

Below is the complete list of NFL Week 8 matchups. You can also check out 506 Sports’ broadcast map to see which Sunday games will air in your region.

Don’t miss your local NFL team in action

Enter your zip code below to find the best TV plans in your area that offer local and primetime NFL channels.

NFL Schedule This Week FAQ

What week is it in the NFL?

It’s currently Week 8 of the 2025 NFL regular season. After a few weeks of chaotic scheduling, we finally have a “normal” one. There are no early-morning international games or overlapping Monday night doubleheaders to worry about.

Which NFL teams have a bye this week?

We have six teams on a bye in Week 8, including the Arizona Cardinals, Detroit Lions, Jacksonville Jaguars, Las Vegas Raiders, Los Angeles Rams, and Seattle Seahawks.

Who is the best team in the NFL today?

After a big Monday night win, the Detroit Lions (5–2) have reclaimed the top spot in the NFL Power Rankings. They’re followed by the surging Indianapolis Colts (6–1), the Kansas City Chiefs (4–3), and the Seattle Seahawks (5–2).

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, has been writing and refining this weekly NFL schedule guide since the 2022 season. Each week, he reviews the official league schedule and cross-references it with every broadcast partner. This process assures the channel listings for each matchup—including Spanish-language and alternate broadcasts—are always accurate.

Taylor’s “Game of the Week” selection comes from that hands-on experience, as he watches multiple games in their entirety every game week. His pick is a blend of on-field analysis (team performance, playoff stakes) and off-field expertise (broadcast accessibility). That dedicated, hands-on experience is what gives this TV guide a true fan’s perspective.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about CableTV.com and the methods we use.

item.title: How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The Milwaukee Brewers return for this MLB season looking to build on last year’s National League Central triumph. Fortunately, you can watch all Brewers games live with the right channels in your TV roster.

The post How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Looking to watch the Milwaukee Brewers today? Fortunately, you can catch all Brewers games live with the right channels and TV setup.

The Brew Crew is rolling through the 2025 MLB season with a ton of momentum, proving last year’s National League Central triumph was no fluke. With head coach Pat Murphy at the helm, the team is embracing a new era—navigating through changes while keeping its World Series dreams alive.

Although MLB was going to take over broadcasting the Brewers’ in-market games, the team ultimately struck a deal to keep local matchups on FanDuel Sports Wisconsin (formerly Bally Sports Wisconsin). That means many TV details remain unchanged from last season. But keep reading, as I outline this season’s viewing specifics—including the complete TV schedule and free viewing options.

Jump to:

  • Milwaukee Brewers channels
  • Milwaukee Brewers TV schedule
  • Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Brewers for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Milwaukee Brewers games?

You can watch in-market Milwaukee Brewers games on FanDuel Sports Network Wisconsin (FDSWI), with select simulcasts airing on over-the-air affiliates throughout Wisconsin. Nationally televised games will appear on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, while some will stream on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

If you live outside the FanDuel Sports Wisconsin broadcast region, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS for out-of-market viewing.

Want radio coverage? Fans can stream home and away radio broadcasts of every Brewers game on MLB At Bat. Games also air on AM and FM stations within the Brewers Radio Network, featuring announcers Jeff Levering, Lane Grindle, and Josh Maurer.

Score the best Milwaukee Brewers TV plan

Enter your zip code below to see top TV and internet providers in your area.

2025 Milwaukee Brewers playoffs TV schedule

The Brewers began the 2025 MLB season with an Opening Day loss against the New York Yankees. In fact, they lost that entire opening series. But you wouldn’t know it now, as Milwaukee rolled into October with the spot in the National League Division Series.

Starting Saturday, October 4, the Brewers will start their journey toward a World Series against the Chicago Cubs, who beat the San Diego Padres in the Wild Card series.

You can watch select Milwaukee Brewers games for free on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, which requires no TV subscription. To identify channels in your area, enter your zip code in the FCC’s Reception Map Tool. Then, explore our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations, including the mid-range Mohu Leaf 50.

Free MLB games also stream daily on MLB.TV. All you need is an MLB.com account to tune in, but blackout restrictions apply for in-market fans.

Another way to watch free games is through a live TV streaming trial. DIRECTV STREAM offers a free five-day trial with core MLB channels and RSNs, including FanDuel Sports Wisconsin. Other free trials are regularly available through Fubo and YouTube TV.

How to watch the Milwaukee Brewers FAQ

Can I watch the Brewers game on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Brewers fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video through the MLB.TV Prime Video Channels add-on. In-market coverage is also available on Prime Video with the FanDuel Sports Network add-on.

Have the Brewers returned to FanDuel Sports Network?

Yes, Brewers games will remain on FanDuel Sports Network (formerly Bally Sports) for the 2025 MLB season. In December 2024, the Brewers announced that they reached an agreement for FanDuel Sports Network to produce and distribute the team’s telecasts for another year.

How can I watch the Brewers on Spectrum?

Spectrum TV customers can watch nationally televised Brewers games on ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. In-market fans can get FanDuel Sports Wisconsin with the TV Select Plus plan, while MLB EXTRA INNINGS is available for out-of-market fans.

Does YouTube TV carry Brewers games?

Yes, YouTube TV carries select Brewers games that air nationally. But the live TV streaming service doesn’t offer FanDuel Sports Wisconsin, MLB Network, or MLB.TV access.

How can I stream the Brewers?

You can stream Milwaukee Brewers games on any live TV streaming service that offers ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. Sling TV is an inexpensive option, but I recommend DIRECTV STREAM for better in-market coverage. You can also stream in-market games on FanDuel Sports Network and out-of-market coverage on MLB.TV.

Why you should trust us

As a Wisconsin native and lifelong Brewers fan, our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, knows exactly what it takes to follow the Brew Crew. For this guide, he combined that fan passion with expert analysis, cross-referencing the full 2025 schedule with the channel lineups and pricing of every major TV provider to find the best deals for Brewers fans.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
ABC, FOX, FS1, TBS, ESPN, and ESPN2 are home to MLB postseason games, and we’ve outlined the best TV providers for tuning in.

The post How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin on Tuesday, September 30, and culminate with the 121st edition of the World Series, which starts Friday, October 24. You can watch playoff games on popular baseball channels from ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports, though channel lineups vary across each round.

American League fans should have FOX and FS1 locked and loaded for key matchups. However, National League followers will need access to TNT Sports channels like TBS and truTV, or a subscription to HBO Max, to catch that side of the postseason bracket.

Scroll down to see which TV providers carry these channels and how you can watch some playoff action for free.

Jump to:

  • MLB Playoffs channels
  • MLB Playoffs TV schedule
  • Watch the MLB Playoffs for free

Get the most MLB action on TV!

Enter your zip code below to browse your area’s top TV and internet providers.

What channels are the MLB Playoffs on?

The 2025 MLB Playoffs will likely air across six channels, based on last year’s schedule:

  • ABC
  • FOX
  • FS1
  • TBS
  • truTV
  • ESPN
  • ESPN2

Most MLB playoff channels are easy to find from various TV providers, but you may need a higher-tier TV plan to access specific networks. Additionally, ESPN Deportes, Fox Deportes, MLB Network, truTV, UniMás, and Univision will carry Spanish-language postseason coverage.

Pro tip: All games airing on FOX and FS1 will stream on FOX One, while TBS games will stream on HBO Max’s Standard and Premium plans. But it’s important to note that you might not need every playoff channel listed above, especially if you’re only tuning in for a specific team.

MLB Playoffs TV schedule

The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin in late September, starting with the Wild Card Series. After that, the action moves to the divisional and league series. The 121st World Series begins in late October.

See the first table below to find out when each series starts and which channels you can watch them on. Then, for a more comprehensive look at each series, click on the drop-down menus a little further down. I’ll be updating the schedules as the postseason unfolds.

Best TV plans for watching the MLB Playoffs

Now that you know the channels you’ll need to watch this year’s playoffs, you have a better idea of what to look for when choosing a TV provider. But we’ll make it a step easier. Here’s a list of our three favorite postseason TV plans.

  • Antenna: You can catch every playoff game airing on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, as long as you’re within range of a local affiliate station. Check out our Watch For Free section below for more on this viewing option.
  • Sling TV + Antenna: Sling TV is the most affordable option for watching the MLB Playoffs because its Sling Orange + Blue plan offers FS1, TBS, and ESPN for just $60.99/mo.. While it lacks nationwide coverage for ABC and FOX, you can still stream ABC games through ESPN3 and use an antenna for FOX broadcasts.
  • YouTube TV: At $82.99/mo., YouTube TV is an excellent service for streaming the MLB Postseason. You’ll get every playoff channel and sick features like multiview and unlimited DVR storage. We typically don’t recommend YouTube TV during the MLB regular season because it lacks MLB Network and crucial regional sports networks. But that won’t affect your viewing experience during the playoffs.

Which TV providers offer MLB playoff channels?

Most major TV providers offer the core MLB playoff networks, covering everything from the Wild Card Series to the World Series. Our table below highlights 13 popular providers and whether they carry the necessary channels.

Get free local channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)

Features:
All local broadcast channels
View on Amazon

CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

Because the MLB Playoffs air across several basic cable networks, you’ll need a TV subscription to access the entire slate of playoff games. Some live TV streaming services offer free trials, but most don’t last longer than seven days.

You can watch a slice of playoff action without subscribing to a TV plan using an OTA antenna on your smart TV. Since ABC and FOX air various playoff games, you can tune in for free through your local network affiliates. That’s especially important since FOX will show the complete World Series.

If you need a high-quality antenna, we suggest checking out the Mohu Leaf 50. It’s one of our favorite antennas because of its 60-mile range and 4K capabilities. Though, you’ll want to enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map Tool before committing to an antenna. That way, you can ensure ABC and FOX stations are within range of your home.

How to watch the MLB Playoffs FAQ

What app can I watch the MLB Playoffs on?

If you already have access to MLB playoff channels through a TV provider, you can watch live games through individual channel apps like ESPN, FOX Sports, and TBS. All you need to do is sign in to each app with your TV provider credentials. You can also watch the MLB Playoffs through the MLB app, but you’ll need an eligible TV provider login for live game access.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs without cable?

Without cable, you can watch the entire MLB Playoffs through most live TV streaming services. We recommend Sling TV because it’s the cheapest way to get ESPN, FS1, and TBS in one plan (Sling Orange + Blue at $60.99/mo.), but you’ll likely need an antenna for FOX coverage.

Does Amazon Prime have the MLB Playoffs?

No, a basic Amazon Prime Video subscription doesn’t include nationally televised MLB games like the MLB Playoffs. But you can watch some MLB coverage through Prime Video using add-ons like HBO Max Standard and MLB.TV.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs in Canada?

In Canada, you can watch live MLB Postseason and World Series games on Sportsnet. The most straightforward way to tune in is with a standard Sportsnet+ subscription. You can also catch Candian French–language coverage on RDS and TVA.

What is the new format for the MLB Playoffs?

The current postseason format launched in 2022 when the MLB expanded to a six-team American League and National League playoff bracket. Now, the Wild Card round is a best-of-three series instead of a single-elimination game, and the top two division winners of each league receive byes into the Division Series. Check out the MLB’s Postseason Format Explainer for a closer look at how it all works.

Why you should trust us

Our baseball experts researched the best ways to watch the MLB Playoffs by comparing the most popular TV providers head to head. We based our viewing recommendations primarily on ease of use—focusing on each provider’s channel lineups, pricing, and set-up process.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.
